items.message: Flooding is possible through Wednesday and Thursday as river levels continue to rise due to heavy rainfall overnight and continuing lighter rainfall today. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further rain is forecast through to Saturday and levels are expected to continue rising. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will issue further alerts and warnings if required. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 13/11/2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 12 November 2025 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. Rainfall is forecast over the next 3 hours. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge will remain high until tomorrow on 13/11/25. 
We are closely monitoring the situation & monitoring river levels and rainfall. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads, 
which may be flooded 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 13 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.message:
Rising river levels throughout Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 12 November 2025 . 
Heavy and persistent rainfall overnight Tuesday into Wednesday has caused river levels to rise. Flooding is possible to low lying land and roads close to the river on Wednesday. The main areas of concern are Seaton, Colyton, Axminster and Axmouth. We expect the river to remain high throughout Wednesday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 13 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high today which has led to flooding.
Flooding continues 12 November 2025. 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Observed peaks:- Llanymynech 4.0m this morning 12/11. Predicted peaks:- Cae Howel 3.4m to 3.6m on 12/11 PM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 13 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. This message will be updated by 9:30PM on 13 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 12 November 2025. Areas most at risk are those around the River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell, including Dogsmouth Brook. We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 10:00 on 13 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
